title: Healthy–Sick–Sicker Microsimulation
text: vignette illustrates use functions provided sickSickerMicrosimPack package simulate cohort individuals progressing four–state health model. health states include Healthy (H), Sick (S1), Sicker (S2) Dead (D). Transition probabilities can depend time spent state well individual covariates age sex. Costs utilities accumulated cycle may discounted. detailed guidance creating R packages, refer online version second edition R Packages book (Wickham Bryan 2023) Posit package development cheatsheet. resources provide comprehensive overviews best practices packaging, documentation, testing continuous integration.

title: Healthy–Sick–Sicker Microsimulation
text: following diagram summarises order operations within simulation specification inputs summarising discounted results.

title: Healthy–Sick–Sicker Microsimulation
text: cycle transition probabilities updated every individual using update_probsV() function. example constructs simple vector occupied states times computes corresponding transition matrix. Transition probabilities four‑individual cohort
code: v_states_names <- c("H", "S1", "S2", "D") v_occupied_state <- c("H", "S1", "S2", "D") v_time_in_state <- c(1,2,3,1) l_trans_probs <- list(   p_HD = 0.005,   p_HS1 = 0.15,   p_S1H = 0.5,   p_S1S2 = 0.105,   p_S1D = 1 - exp(-3 * (-log(1-0.005))),   p_S2D = 1 - exp(-10 * (-log(1-0.005))),   rp_S1 = 0.2,   rp_S2 = 0.29 )  m_probs <- update_probsV(   v_states_names = v_states_names,    v_occupied_state = v_occupied_state,   l_trans_probs = l_trans_probs,   v_time_in_state = v_time_in_state )  knitr::kable(   x = m_probs,   caption = "Transition probabilities for a four‑individual cohort" )

title: Healthy–Sick–Sicker Microsimulation
text: following code runs small simulation ten individuals five cycles. Individual characteristics sampled passed run_microSimV() together cost utility parameters. average total costs QALYs per individual returned. methodology behind package application cost–effectiveness modelling described detail tutorial packaging cost‑effectiveness models R (Smith, Mohammed, Schneider 2023).
code: set.seed(123) num_i <- 10 num_cycles <- 5 v_start <- rep("H", num_i) m_feats <- cbind(age = rnorm(num_i, 50, 3), sex = sample(c(0,1), num_i, replace = TRUE)) v_states_costs <- c(H = 2000, S1 = 4000, S2 = 15000, D = 0) v_cost_coeffs  <- c(age = 11.5, sex = 300) v_states_utilities <- c(H = 1, S1 = 0.75, S2 = 0.5, D = 0) v_util_coeffs <- c(age = -0.0018, sex = -0.015) v_util_t_decs <- c(S1 = -0.0015, S2 = -0.0020) l_trans_probs <- list(p_HD = 0.005, p_HS1 = 0.15, p_S1H = 0.5,                       p_S1S2 = 0.105, p_S1D = 0.01488751,                       p_S2D = 0.04877166, rp_S1 = 0.2, rp_S2 = 0.29) res <- run_microSimV(   v_starting_states = v_start,   num_i = num_i,   num_cycles = num_cycles,   m_indi_features = m_feats,   v_states_names = v_states_names,   v_states_costs = v_states_costs,   v_cost_coeffs = v_cost_coeffs,   v_states_utilities = v_states_utilities,   v_util_coeffs = v_util_coeffs,   v_util_t_decs = v_util_t_decs,   l_trans_probs = l_trans_probs,   discount_rate_costs = 0.03,   discount_rate_QALYs = 0.015,   cycle_length = 1,   starting_seed = 1 )  res$mean_costs #> [1] 14428.73 res$mean_qalys #> [1] 5.167632

title: Healthy–Sick–Sicker–Dead Microsimulation Model
text: sickSickerMicrosimPack provides set functions build run microsimulation model four health states: Healthy (H), Sick (S1), Sicker (S2) Dead (D). model vectorised efficiently simulate large cohorts individuals. Transition probabilities can depend time spent state individual characteristics, costs utilities can modified covariates.

title: Healthy–Sick–Sicker–Dead Microsimulation Model
text: can install development version sickSickerMicrosimPack GitHub : Alternatively, can clone repository build/install manually.

title: Healthy–Sick–Sicker–Dead Microsimulation Model
text: following example simulates small cohort 10 individuals five cycles. Individual ages sexes sampled, transition probabilities provided along cost utility parameters. example returns average costs QALYs per individual. Refer documentation individual functions details parameters usage.
code: # load the package library(sickSickerMicrosimPack) # define model inputs num_i <- 10 num_cycles <- 5 v_start <- rep("H", num_i) m_feats <- cbind(   age = rnorm(num_i, 50, 3),    sex = sample(c(0,1), num_i, replace = TRUE) ) v_states_names <- c("H", "S1", "S2", "D") v_states_costs <- c(H = 2000, S1 = 4000, S2 = 15000, D = 0) v_cost_coeffs  <- c(age = 11.5, sex = 300) v_states_utilities <- c(H = 1, S1 = 0.75, S2 = 0.5, D = 0) v_util_coeffs <- c(age = -0.0018, sex = -0.015) v_util_t_decs <- c(S1 = -0.0015, S2 = -0.0020) l_trans_probs <- list(   p_HD = 0.005,    p_HS1 = 0.15,    p_S1H = 0.5,   p_S1S2 = 0.105,   p_S1D = 0.01488751,   p_S2D = 0.04877166,   rp_S1 = 0.2,   rp_S2 = 0.29 )  res <- run_microSimV(   v_starting_states = v_start,   num_i = num_i,   num_cycles = num_cycles,   m_indi_features = m_feats,   v_states_names = v_states_names,   v_states_costs = v_states_costs,   v_cost_coeffs = v_cost_coeffs,   v_states_utilities = v_states_utilities,   v_util_coeffs = v_util_coeffs,   v_util_t_decs = v_util_t_decs,   l_trans_probs = l_trans_probs,   discount_rate_costs = 0.03,   discount_rate_QALYs = 0.015,   cycle_length = 1,   starting_seed = 1 )  res$mean_costs #> [1] 14552.97 res$mean_qalys #> [1] 5.143042

title: Calculate Costs — calc_costsV
text: Computes cost incurred individual cycle based current health state individual covariates. Costs states S1 S2 can modified regression coefficients applied individual features (e.g. age, sex).

title: Calculate Costs — calc_costsV
Calculate Costs — calc_costsV
text: v_occupied_state Character vector current state individual. v_states_costs Named numeric vector base costs state. m_indi_features Matrix data.frame individual covariates; number rows must match v_occupied_state. v_cost_coeffs Numeric vector regression coefficients individual covariates used calculate additional costs states S1 S2.

title: Calculate Costs — calc_costsV
text: numeric vector costs current cycle individual.

title: Calculate Costs — calc_costsV
code: v_occupied_state <- c("H", "S1", "S2", "D") v_states_costs <- c(H = 2000, S1 = 4000, S2 = 15000, D = 0) m_indi_features <- cbind(age = c(50, 60, 70, 80), sex = c(0, 1, 0, 1)) v_cost_coeffs <- c(age = 11.5, sex = 300)  calc_costsV(   v_occupied_state = v_occupied_state,    v_states_costs = v_states_costs,    m_indi_features = m_indi_features,   v_cost_coeffs = v_cost_coeffs ) #> [1]  2000  4990 15805     0

title: Calculate Discount Weights — calc_discount_wts
text: Computes discount weights sequence cycles given discount rate expressed per annum length cycle. weights can multiplied costs QALYs obtain discounted values.

title: Calculate Discount Weights — calc_discount_wts
Calculate Discount Weights — calc_discount_wts
text: discount_rate Annual discount rate expressed fraction (e.g. 0.03). num_cycles Integer giving number cycles simulation. cycle_length Length cycle years.

title: Calculate Discount Weights — calc_discount_wts
text: numeric vector discount weights length num_cycles + 1.

title: Calculate Discount Weights — calc_discount_wts
Calculate Health Outcomes (QALYs) — calc_effsV
text: Computes quality adjusted life years accrued single cycle individual. Utilities states S1 S2 adjusted individual covariate coefficients time spent state.

title: Calculate Health Outcomes (QALYs) — calc_effsV
code: calc_effsV(   v_occupied_state,   v_states_utilities,   m_indi_features,   v_util_coeffs,   v_util_t_decs,   v_time_in_state,   cycle_length = 1 )

title: Calculate Health Outcomes (QALYs) — calc_effsV
text: v_occupied_state Character vector current state individual. v_states_utilities Named numeric vector base utilities state. m_indi_features Matrix data.frame individual covariates. v_util_coeffs Numeric vector regression coefficients individual covariates used calculate utility decrements. v_util_t_decs Named numeric vector time‑dependent utility decrements states S1 S2. names must correspond state names. v_time_in_state Numeric vector indicating time spent current state. cycle_length Length one cycle measured years. Defaults 1.

title: Calculate Health Outcomes (QALYs) — calc_effsV
Calculate Health Outcomes (QALYs) — calc_effsV
code: v_occupied_state <- c("H", "S1", "S2", "D") v_states_utilities <- c(H = 1, S1 = 0.75, S2 = 0.5, D = 0) m_indi_features <- cbind(age = c(50, 60, 70, 80), sex = c(0, 1, 0, 1)) v_util_coeffs <- c(age = -0.0018, sex = -0.015) v_util_t_decs <- c(S1 = -0.0015, S2 = -0.002) v_time_in_state <- c(1, 2, 3, 4)  calc_effsV(   v_occupied_state = v_occupied_state,   v_states_utilities = v_states_utilities,   m_indi_features = m_indi_features,   v_util_coeffs = v_util_coeffs,   v_util_t_decs = v_util_t_decs,   v_time_in_state = v_time_in_state ) #> [1] 0.910 0.624 0.368 0.000

Run Healthy–Sick–Sicker–Dead Microsimulation — run_microSimV
text: Runs vectorised microsimulation cohort individuals specified number cycles. Individuals transition health states according probabilities depend current state time spent state. Costs QALYs accumulated cycle optionally discounted.

title: Run Healthy–Sick–Sicker–Dead Microsimulation — run_microSimV
code: run_microSimV(   v_starting_states,   num_i,   num_cycles,   m_indi_features,   v_states_names,   v_states_costs,   v_cost_coeffs,   v_states_utilities,   v_util_coeffs,   v_util_t_decs,   l_trans_probs,   discount_rate_costs,   discount_rate_QALYs,   cycle_length = 1,   starting_seed = 1 )

title: Run Healthy–Sick–Sicker–Dead Microsimulation — run_microSimV
text: v_starting_states Character vector giving starting state individual. num_i Integer giving number individuals cohort. num_cycles Integer giving number cycles simulate. m_indi_features Matrix data.frame individual covariates rows corresponding individuals columns corresponding features. Must include column named age incremented cycle. v_states_names Character vector state names order used throughout model. v_states_costs Named numeric vector base costs state. v_cost_coeffs Numeric vector regression coefficients costs. v_states_utilities Named numeric vector base utilities state. v_util_coeffs Numeric vector regression coefficients utilities. v_util_t_decs Named numeric vector time‑dependent utility decrements states S1 S2. l_trans_probs Named list transition probabilities rate ratios; see update_probsV details. discount_rate_costs Annual discount rate used costs. discount_rate_QALYs Annual discount rate used QALYs. cycle_length Length cycle years. Defaults 1. starting_seed Optional seed random number generator allow reproducible results.

title: Run Healthy–Sick–Sicker–Dead Microsimulation — run_microSimV
text: list containing matrices states, costs QALYs cycle, undiscounted discounted totals per individual averages across individuals.

title: Run Healthy–Sick–Sicker–Dead Microsimulation — run_microSimV
code: res <- run_microSimV(   v_starting_states = v_starting_states,   num_i = num_i,   num_cycles = num_cycles,   m_indi_features = m_indi_features,   v_states_names = v_states_names,   v_states_costs = v_states_costs,   v_cost_coeffs = v_cost_coeffs,   v_states_utilities = v_states_utilities,   v_util_coeffs = v_util_coeffs,   v_util_t_decs = v_util_t_decs,   l_trans_probs = l_trans_probs,    discount_rate_costs = discount_rate_costs,   discount_rate_QALYs = discount_rate_QALYs,   cycle_length = cycle_length,   starting_seed = seed )  res$mean_costs #> [1] 98822.67 res$mean_qalys #> [1] 18.72664

title: Sample Health States — sampleV
text: Samples health state individual given row transition probability matrix. multinomial sampling approach used whereby uniform random number compared cumulative probabilities determine next state.

title: Sample Health States — sampleV
Sample Health States — sampleV
text: m_trans_probs matrix transition probabilities rows corresponding individuals columns states. v_states_names Character vector state names matching column order m_trans_probs.

title: Sample Health States — sampleV
text: character vector sampled next state row m_trans_probs.

title: Sample Health States — sampleV
code: m_probs <- matrix(   data = c(0.8, 0.2, 0, 0, 0.1, 0.7, 0.1, 0.1),   nrow = 2,   byrow = TRUE ) colnames(m_probs) <- c("H", "S1", "S2", "D") sampleV(   m_trans_probs = m_probs,    v_states_names = colnames(m_probs) ) #> [1] "S1" "S1"

title: Random number generator state — seed
Random number generator state — seed
Random number generator state — seed
Update Transition Probabilities — update_probsV
text: Computes transition probability matrix individual cohort given current health state, time spent state list baseline probabilities modifiers. Probabilities adjusted mortality using rate ratios time state. resulting matrix one row per individual one column possible next state.

title: Update Transition Probabilities — update_probsV
Update Transition Probabilities — update_probsV
text: v_states_names Character vector possible health states. v_occupied_state Character vector giving current state individual. l_trans_probs named list containing baseline transition probabilities (p_HD, p_HS1, p_S1H, p_S1S2, p_S1D, p_S2D) rate ratios (rp_S1, rp_S2) used update mortality probabilities. v_time_in_state Numeric vector indicating time individual spent current state. Must length v_occupied_state.

title: Update Transition Probabilities — update_probsV
text: matrix transition probabilities rows corresponding individuals columns corresponding health states listed v_states_names. row sums one.

title: Update Transition Probabilities — update_probsV
code: v_states_names <- c("H", "S1", "S2", "D") v_occupied_state <- c("H", "S1") l_trans_probs <- list(   p_HD = 0.005,   p_HS1 = 0.15,   p_S1H = 0.5,   p_S1S2 = 0.105,   p_S1D = 1 - exp(-3 * (-log(1-0.005))),   p_S2D = 1 - exp(-10 * (-log(1-0.005))), rp_S1 = 0.2,   rp_S2 = 0.29 ) v_time_in_state <- c(1, 2)  m_probs <- update_probsV(   v_states_names,   v_occupied_state,   l_trans_probs,   v_time_in_state  )  rowSums(m_probs) #>  H S1  #>  1  1
